729704f-a.title: Richmond: Stewart Avenue - Watchogue Road
729704f-a.text:
Stewart Avenue, east side, 10: yards south of Watchogue
Road, showing the old Vreeland House. Before Stewart '-venue
was laid out the entrace to the house and farnm Was from
Watchogue Road.
About 1900
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

729883f.title: Richmond: Watchogue Road - Stewart Avenue
729883f.text:
Pero-Christopher House, 441 Watchogue Avenue, n.w.
cor. Stewart Avenue, Staten Island. Hts stone walls
are two feet thick.
n.d.
Acquired from the New York Herald Iribune sorgue,
1948. 48(482
729883f.folder: Watchogue Road & Stewart Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729884f-b.title: Richmond: Watchogue Road - Stewart Avenue
729884f-b.text:
(1)
441 atchomue Road, adjoininm the N.W. corner of Stewart
Avenue (formerly Willowhrook Road), showing the Pero House,
dating back to colonial times. The house derives its name from
Peter Pero, who distinguished himself i the Civil War. The
property was boucht by Garret Cruser in 1739; Daniel Winant
owned it in 1839; Ailliam H. Pero boummt it in 1878. It is
also referred to as the Pero Christophr House.
Jure 18, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Another view, a cross Wotchogue Road.
June 18, 1938.
P.L. Sperr
NO RPPRODUCTIONS.
